alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 31 at 2:11PM AKDT until September 02 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...The Tanana River from Old Minto to Manley Hot Springs * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...The Tanana River is near or at bankfull from Old Minto to Manley Hot Springs. As water levels gradually rise into the weekend, minor flooding is possible of low-lying areas near the river. Water levels will remain high into early next week. For those recreating or hunting on the Tanana and Nenana Rivers, all gravel bars will be covered with water, debris will be in the river, along with increased erosion. Be cautious of rising water levels if you plan to park your vehicle near the river while out on your boat. A Flood Advisory is currently in effect until Noon Monday from Nenana to Old Minto. Please see that product for more details. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain that fell over the Alaska Range since last weekend is causing high water on the Tanana River. Additional heavy rain in the Alaska Range and in the Tanana Valley over the next few days will result in more runoff into the Tanana and Nenana Rivers into the weekend. - Http://www.weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Tanana River from Old Minto to Manley Hot Springs stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
